content:
is there a way to string interpolate with a Repr instance, or does it absolutely have to be ToString? this is the only relevant docs i saw https://lean-lang.org/lean4/doc/stringinterp.html

in rust land, I would want println!("{:?}", foo) instead of println!("{}", foo)
insofar as a rust Debug instance is analogous to a lean Repr instance
What's the context where you're doing this? There's different advice depending on some details, whether the result you want is MessageData, Format, or String
The result I want is String, I just want to be lazy and not handroll ToString instances all over the place
I mean to ask what do you want to do with the string, just in case there's something else that would work better here.

Here's how to use the Repr instance:

example [Repr α] (x : α) : String :=
  s!"x is {repr x}"
yeah this is just for debug prints
I figured, which is why I'm asking, because usually you don't use repr since, for example, logInfo takes a MessageData, which can give you more sophisticated data in the infoview
(but if you're printing lots of custom types, then may as well use Repr)
interesting, thanks! yeah I'm trying to be quick and jank here, I'll learn about logging later
Quinn has marked this topic as resolved.
